column4: Hmmm I'm seeing a lot of freezes at or shortly after bootup since the last few 'upgrades' on current 7.10 ... anybody else see or know of such a similar increase (originally I thought it was that my system just stopped accepting keyboard and/or mouse inputs, but now I think the entire system is freezing..
sometimes it's after I've logged in, sometimes it's before..
sometimes it's before I'm even able to log in.
clearze - i've done that.. it seems to output nothing, and the point is.. at some points cntrl alt f1 becomes totally useless.
yes, I know what dmesg does
the problem is... that... if I can successfully apply dmesg... then I haven't seen the problem
the system totally freezes to the point of a hardware reboot being the only solution.
clearze - no other system to check - unlikely I think.  As I said, I've thought originally that it was just stopping accepting input from the keyboard/mouse, but now I think it's entirely freezing
when you get the grub menu, you can select the entry you normally boot and press 'e'... then you can edit the kernel boot line...

levande - yes, I see that... and it stops at different points.. or it gets to the logon screen.. or it lets me login and start x... or it lets me logon via console.. and THEN it freezes.. it's being totally unpredictable
select it and press 'e' again, add 'nosplash' and remove 'quiet'
then press enter and then 'b' to boot
you can also permanently disable splash by editing /boot/grub/menu.lst and then running sudo update-grub
yeah thanks.. no clue yet. :|
vspike yeah - that no-text splash screen is annoying.. I mean I like graphical.. and progress bars and all.. but it WOULD be nice to have the text scroll too..
yeah, i prefer to see the boot messages :) they just hide them because to many people who are new to linux they look scary and old-fashioned :)
vspike - yeah.. they should provide a simple way to turn them on to display in a small box on the splash screen.. and call it a "diagnostic mode" or something. :)
- you may find that the recovery mode has the splash disabled by default
- I don't think it's internal temps.. my computer is in an unheated room and it's winter where I am now..
vspike - yeah, but I sort of meant as both a way for newbies to not be scared and for old timers to get the data they want.. all the time.. rather than just at recovery time
i see what you mean
